article:
"I would do something special for her. Something I wouldn't ordinarily do." With tears  _  down his face, a gentleman said in an interview. The gentleman, whose  _  had just died in an accident, was answering the reporter's question, "What would you do  _  if you had known you might not see your wife again?" Of course, we would all act differently  _   we knew our time together with our love was running out.
Back at the house, starting a load of laundry, I found myself thinking about the  _  . "I would do something special"  _  over and over again in my mind. That gentleman would never have that   _   , but I did. I hope my husband, Alan, and I have   _   forty years together. But there are no guarantees. Tomorrows are not  _  .
When doing the washing, I had a little problem: I couldn't   _  the washing machine. All these years I had been   depending on   Alan to help me deal with such a situation. Suddenly I found it very important for me to fix the machine and give Alan a  _  . Then I began to   _   what was wrong. Several   _  later, with no improvement and an aching arm, I thought I might not  _  . But thinking about that gentleman's words, I decided to   _   on trying. The motor finally started and that day Alan was really   _   at my work.
I was   _   for the lessons I learned that day. First of all, the reporter brought home a very important point.   _   his pain, the gentleman who had lost his love taught me to   _  what was mine. I will continue to look for those "special" things to do for Alan.
